snippet: A church official who recently won an appeal of his conviction in the priest-abuse scandal was released from custody, and Philadelphia’s Roman Catholic archbishop defended the decision to use church funds to help with the bail.
abstract: Msgr William J Lynn, who won an appeal of his conviction in priest-abuse scandal, is released from custody; Philadelphia’s Roman Catholic archbishop defends decision to use church funds to help with his bail; Lynn is the first American church official to have been charged for hiding complaints that priests were molesting children.
lead_paragraph: A church official who recently won an appeal of his conviction in the priest-abuse scandal was released from custody, and Philadelphia’s Roman Catholic archbishop defended the decision to use church funds to help with the bail.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Archdiocese Defends Bail for Monsignor
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: Archdiocese Defends Bail For Monsignor
